intro: [WRONG START] Hieracius filarszkyi, commonly known as the Hungarian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It has serrated leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
